thread.title: Derry to Dublin Bus Éireann service to end in May - BBC News
thread.title_full: Derry to Dublin Bus Éireann service to end in May - BBC News

title: Derry to Dublin Bus Éireann service to end in May - BBC News
text:
Derry to Dublin Bus Éireann service to end in May 28 February 2017 Image copyright Google Image caption The company said they will end the service at the end of May Bus Éireann has announced it intends to close its Londonderry to Dublin bus service on 28 May. 
The Irish company said on Monday that the service was one of three routes set to be slashed as part of its cost-cutting plans. 
Management told staff that they had no option but to implement "immediate cost savings". 
The bus operator currently runs twice-daily return journeys to Dublin, alongside Translink's Goldline service. 
A Translink spokesperson said it was aware of the changes but was "committed" to keeping the route. 
"We are in close communication with Bus Éireann about their intentions on the Derry-Londonderry to Dublin route. 
"Translink is committed to maintaining connectivity between Derry-Londonderry and Dublin." 
The Republic of Ireland's transport unions have said that they will commence an all-out strike at Bus Éireann next week, in response to the cost-cutting plans. 
The National Bus and Rail Union and SIPTU has also warned that there will be redundancies and impact on pay - but says the moves are necessary to save the company. 
The company is also closing their Dublin to Clonmel and Athlone to Westport services.
